alert.note: Alert for Coos (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 14 at 11:08AM PST until January 15 at 7:21AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Oregon... Coquille River at Coquille affecting Coos County. North Fork Coquille River near Myrtle Point affecting Coos County. South Fork Coquille River at Myrtle Point affecting Coos County. For the Coquille River...including Coquille...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the South Fork Coquille River...including Myrtle Point... Moderate flooding is forecast. For the North Fork Coquille River...including Myrtle Point...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...North Fork Coquille River near Myrtle Point. * WHEN...Until Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 35.0 feet, Expect widespread pasture and agricultural flooding. Moderate bank erosion along the North Fork Coquille River and its tributaries can also be expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM PST Sunday the stage was 35.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 29.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:45 AM PST Sunday was 35.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 35.6 feet late this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening, but remain at bankfull into Monday morning. - Flood stage is 35.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 35.8 feet on 01/20/2012. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening.this evening at 1100 PM PST.
